content: 1 treble_crochet … = curved brackets enclose explanatory notes notes i would say that working to the right gauge to create the airy fabric is probably the most challenging thing about making this muffler it s a very easy thing to do when you re used to it but it takes a bit of time and practise to perfect this kind of gauge when working with a fine yarn although the mohair yarn is rather unforgiving when it comes to frogging when you make a mistake if you need to rip back at any point do it very slowly and gently its cunning little hairs will also help you to create and hold the structure in the arches and fans of the stitch pattern the best advice i can offer is to keep your hands and gauge relaxed but consistent the stitch pattern used is called little fans if you prefer to make a longer and slimmer scarf sized version of the pattern you ll need to know that this is worked as a multiple of 6 stitches plus 1 add 1 more stitch for the foundation chain here s a schematic for the stitch pattern by debbie seton of the crimson rabbit www thecrimsonrabbit co uk copyright 2016 you must obtain permission before redistributing and in all cases this notice must remain intact
